name: Drake Roberts
text:
Just left this place never been till now I came in looking for a Lenovo laptop charger and the man behind the counter said he doesn't know if he had any new and said he was not sure if he had any used and suggested Walmart
Didn't even make an attempt to check only said he wasn't sure then auggsugge I go elsewhere I got the feeling I was bothering him just by being a customer would not recommend and will never be back

resp.text: Thanks for your review. I just reviewed the recording to be sure you were helped as best as possible. We are a repair shop, and as such are unable to carry every different brand and model adapter. Dylan knew right off the bat that we do not carry the new Lenovo adapter you were searching for. We have in shop adapters that we use for repairs, he should have been more clear about his response. He also recommended Walmart, because he was trying to help you find the adapter. He gave you a card and asked you to keep us in mind in case you had anything we could help you with. Sorry you felt like he was dismissive, but we simply did not have what you were looking for. Best of luck on your search.

name: David Hill
text: Strictly about getting as much of your money for as little as possible.Deceptive and highly overpriced.Be sure you already know what's wrong before you bring your Pc there,if not they'll make it worse before making it better and charge 3 Times as much as original problem should have been.

resp.text:
Hi Stranger! Are you sure you left a review for the correct business? I have no record of you in my system, and I can assure you I would be aware of any such interaction as the one you described. I would love to hear from you, we do our best to correct any situation. 2519294609

Also, if you're able to provide me with the time that you interacted with my techs, I'll be sure to review any phone calls or video of the shop to make sure our high standards are being met. I'm having trouble understanding your review for a few reasons -

1- I have no documented interactions with you and am unable to reach you.
2- We NEVER charge for anything without the customers approval.
3- We always take into account the value of the equipment brought to us so we can justify the cost of repair. Unfortunately, a lot of equipment brought in for repair is not worth the cost of repair. We decline to repair a lot of equipment. In these situations we offer alternative solutions such as migrating to a new computer, or providing a backup so you can purchase equipment elsewhere.
4- There is another business in the area with a very similar name that has caused confusion in the past. I cannot speak to the quality of the work they perform, I just know we have been mistaken for them quite often.

Still looking forward to speaking with you personally and clearing up any confusion.
Judge Keeler - 251.929.4609

text: I dropped off a pc due to freezing on monday night. They had it all week and picked it up on friday night. They stated it was the second hard drive causing the issues and all was perfect. I got home tonight plugged it in and froze up within 1 minute. How do you have a pc a whole week and the first minute I get it plugged back in the pc freezes again? Something is wrong and the problem was not diagnosed properly.

text: The best problem fixers ever!!!!

name: Mary T
text:
DO NOT USE THIS PLACE!!!

Took in my Galaxy S7 Edge after I dropped it and screen turned green and flickered. Everything else was working great, including charging.

Was told it needed new screen. Paid $230 with my debit card and was then informed that there would be no warranty. Got an email receipt.

Got my phone back a few days later and it was down to 1%. So I immediately tried to charge it and got an error message that the battery temp was too low to charge.

Went in the next morning and was told it needed a new battery because old battery would not charge new LED screen (which I should have been told on first visit). Paid $60 MORE. Also told there was no tax since I paid with cash and was not offered a receipt nor one by email (like previous time).

My husband picks the phone up, tries to charge it and gets the SAME error message.

He calls them and is now told that the motherboard is probably bad and it needs a new one. NO FLIPPING WAY was I giving them another dime!!

I am out almost $300 and STILL have no phone to use!!!

They basically  just took my money and did not fix my phone.

I DO NOT recommend this place AT ALL and will be contacting BBB!

resp.text: Mam, I'm sorry that the repair did not work out to your satisfaction. We did everything in our power to help you with your phone. And provided you with every option at our disposal. And we did everything that we could over the phone to explain to you the error that your phone was still having from both me and my assistant. Unfortunately sometimes when performing a repair, be it on a car a house or an electronic device there is more wrong with it than just the issue that you drop it off for. These issues are unfortunate, nonetheless, but sometimes they are there. I apologize you're unsatisfied, and if you change your mind and decide to get the device fixed as we said on the phone, the amount that you have already paid for the battery repair will apply towards the motherboard. I hope you have a great day and if you need anything else give us a call!!

name: Kim McConnon
text: Best place around! Easy to get affordable phone repairs! Much appreciated! They are knowledgeable and make it stress free

name: Blair McAbee
text:
Although my phone was repaired, I will not recomend them. I do not trust businesses that ask for payment up front and then tell you they have a no refund policy if their service comes into question. Just because you call something a store policy, does not make it legally or morally correct.
I award this business a negative one star rating.

resp.text: Glad that your phone works! I cannot find a ticket for repair with your info on it ... Nonetheless, the business policies that we've developed over the years are a direct reflection on experiences we've had in the past. And I assure you in this industry they are very commonplace. The parts that we use do carry a warranty. Again glad to hear that your phone's doing well, you need anything please let us know!

text: Was quoted one price, called the next day and was told it would be an extra $20 for overnight shipping even though the day before was told it would also arrive the next day for repair. resp.text:
Hi Brandon!!!
We did order your part for overnight delivery, unfortunately due to an error in FedEx system we did not receive it overnight. I do remember the conversation with you and did agree that it would be no issue to refund you the overnight shipping. We received the part and had it in your hands today as well as the refund. and after watching the tape I couldn't find a single instance where my employee called you ridiculous. But nonetheless, I apologize that you had an unpleasant experience and we look forward to helping you next time should the need arise. Have a great day!!

name: Harper Lee
text:
Total scam. First you pay 40 dollars to get the phone evaluated which was not explained from the start, then another hundred for a potential repair not a guaranteed repair mind you! I should have just got a replacement from my phone company for a hundred. I was trying to get my contacts. What a waste of forty dollars time  and potentially wasting a total of
140 dollars with no guarantee! He must pay for reviews as he is not credible or honest! Unbelievable, he is still in business! Don’t trust anything he says or states! Go elsewhere,  anywhere but there! Trust me there are far more reputable honest folks that charge the right amount to start and either can or can not do the repair.

I am reporting him to better business bureau for his deception and dishonesty.

resp.text:
Miss Lee we wish you the best as we did on the phone the other day. We charge 40 $ to diagnose any device that comes in unresponsive, to cover our costs  and then apply that money towards the total cost of the repair if the customer chooses to do so. We explain that without fail every time we do a diagnostic. I apologize for any misunderstanding that you had with us in our initial conversation.

We take the word guarantee very seriously, and would never guarantee repair on a phone we haven't seen in months. That Miss Lee and that alone is why would not guarantee a repair. We do guarantee our repairs and most of all parts have a lifetime warranty. I'm sorry that you felt that this review was necessary as well as  the conversation and language you used with us on the phone the other day was necessary but we do sincerely wish you the best.

JF

text: I pick up Wish orders here sometimes. The owners are super friendly. The wife makes jewelry from some of the parts from inside old computers! Very unique and very affordable! Lots of extras in this hidden gem! 😉

name: Mary Moore
text:
I brought in my Dell laptop as I could not get it out of an "infinite boot loop" or "infinite restart." I ended up getting a new laptop and a data transfer. I interacted with all three team members listed on the site and they were all friendly and professional. The building is clean and organized.

However, I dropped it off at noon on a Thursday for it to be tested as they believed it was something else. The receipt/contract sheet I was given said 1-2 business days, but it ended up being 7 before they got to my computer, not counting Sunday. By this point I had already purchased a new laptop and decided I just wanted a data transfer. This was my first time using this business so I have no idea if this is indicative of the average wait period. I know they experienced property damage recently due to the snow storm and I would imagine that would set their workflow back a good bit. I like to give people the benefit of doubt.

They also sell a wide variety of new and used electronic products and when I went in the first time they even had a lot of unrelated merchandise jewelry, stickers, etc.

4/5 overall good experience. I normally don't leave reviews but I was impressed enough by this.

name: Jarmarcus Lewis
text: Tervor was very condescending with his remarks about my role as a customer. I did not feel that he valued my business. He offered other places that I take my business instead of assuring that my product would be repaired in the timely manner. I am sure that Tervor will not miss my one repair job, and his business will continue on.  However, ever customer is important to some businesses and I will spend my money at them.

resp.text:
My grandfather had a saying, "when you tell half truths, you deal in all lies."

I did call you, left a voicemail, saying that I didnt appreciate the way you spoke with my staff, and that your system had been here only 8 Business Days, when the repair time clearly posted at time of drop off was 10 business days. I told you that based on that you would have your system with Saturday or Monday, but in your review you state I didn't assure you when it would be repaired "in a timely manner", however I did tell you when, and it was timely based on the posted repair wait at time of drop off.

You state I offered other places, that is possibly the only true part of your review. I offered the other places around that could get to your repair if the wait wasn't doable for you.

You stated you was a "manager of a big box store" and that you "worked for AT&T" and that you don't treat a customer like this. To which I informed you I was "not a big box store, and I wouldn't let anyone treat my employee's wrongly."

Upon further looking into this, another lie came out. You are not a manager at AT&T, just a sales person. I know this, cause our business has over 55 lines with AT&T.

I hope you take this opportunity to learn to treat people the way you want to be treated, cause if you treat my staff improperly, I will call you out.

name: Barry Reding
text: My son took his computer to these people last Saturday. The technician told him the problem was most likely to he power supply and showed him the power supply that was needed. My son saw the price tag on the power supply read $80. Today (Wednesday) at 3pm my son went to pick up the computer because they hadn’t fixed it. They require a $35 deposit and would not give him the money back because it is non refundable. They did no work to the computer. I found this shady to say the least given the fact they did no work. I called and after being passed off to four different people I questioned the deposit. I was told by all four people that the deposit was necessary because people bring their computers there and never come to pick them up. I pointed out that was not the case here. I then asked if I could come there and purchase the power supply for $80 minus the $35 that had already been paid. At first the answer was yes you can do that but we won’t guarantee the part. I said I was fine with that. As the conversation progressed and I pressed for a solid answer on the purchase person number four (apparently the top of the ladder there) he began to to fish tail. He said power supplies can range in price. I reminded him the technician actually showed the power supply to my son that was needed for his computer. The price tag said $80. He said you can bring the computer back and we will look at it before the EOB today. At this point I wouldn’t trust these people to hold a penny. Person number four hung up me. It’s a scam. Stay away from these people.

resp.text:
Your system was dropped off on Saturday.  There is a sign clearly posted that it is currently 3 business days before a technician gets to your repair.  You choose to come pick up your system before the technician got to it on the 3rd business day (it was the next item on his list to work on for the record).  You spoke with 3 separate people when you asked for a refund on the non-refundable deposit every customer pays at drop off.  All 3 offered to have you bring the system back with no additional deposit for the technician to work on the system.  The technician even offered to work on the system immediately if you brought it back in today.  You refused.  One of the owners agreed to your request that the deposit be applied to purchase of a power supply, even though there is no verification that a power supply will fix the system.  This did not satisfy you either.  Services have been offered multiple times.  The bench fee is clearly covered at drop off and with signs on the counter at drop off.  If you had chosen to bring the system back, the $35 bench fee would be applied to your over all bill.  No one from our store told you to come pick up your system, what was wrong with it, or that we could not fix it.  We still offered you services that you choose to refuse.

The offers were made by multiple employees as well as one of the owners. All calls are recorded and the offers were recorded as well. The security video and audio is available upon request. And the offer still stands, you are welcome to bring it back in or apply the deposit to anything in store, same as owner offered on phone.

We strive for 100% satisfaction from every client, at every interaction.  We want you to become family, and I hope you feel you have.

Thank you for your trust and support! One day, maybe, you will get to teach one of our little ones in high school!

text: Stay Away, I took my repair in over 2 months ago. He told me parts are over seas. He is never open, does not answer the phone, ignores my calls. Thief!

resp.text:
We apologize that you feel we could do something to get parts here faster. Due to the COVID19 Pandemic, lock downs, and shutdowns in our Country as well as in many companies’ factories are in, such as China and Japan, parts have become hard to get. When they do arrive, they must clear customs. Normal shipping from overseas is 2-4 weeks, without any delays. We work as hard as possible to keep our customers happy, however some things are out of our control. Shipping is one.

As far as phone calls, our office is manned Mon-Fri 9AM-6PM, there is an auto attendant and Voice Mail should we be on other line. We also have email available on our drop off forms for customers to contact. If you have any questions please email me at info@nextgencomputers.net.

Please also give me the name your repair is registered in, as we do not have anything in the name "Allison England" and I will be glad to look into why it took so long.

Our technicians are 100% certified, and as such, all adults. Children being here doesn't change our business practices or our ability to serve clients. It only shows the world, what a TRUE family owned business is!

text:
gosh, where do I start................last year when all the FBI scams were going around I called the (other people) who had been charging me $85.00 to just look at my PC. Lucky for me no one answer the phone. So I told my self I would go to the first place where someone answered the phone at 8 A.M.................and guess who it was Dan at Bisdex!
Had to call him today and he helped me out over the phone. Can't ask for a more honest person !    So if you need help with your PC call Dan @ Bisdex

name: Sayres Harbin
text:
I came back from a trip and found my computer power supply had shorted out. This  caused the motherboard to also fry.I decided to take my desktop to Dan for him to inspect. Dans conclusion really pissed me off. Dan wanted me to scrap the entire thing TO HIM (for free) and back up my files on one of his external hard-drives. Then he wanted me to buy one of his Franken-computers he had in the back. The funny thing is, I'm well aware of the parts in my computer and some are relatively new parts. I decided to get my documents backed up on MY external hard-drive and bid him adieu. He wouldn't take no for an answer and ended overcharged me for this process ($90 for a backup WOW). Also, it might be a clear indicator of what type of business this man runs when he charges someone full price for parts labeled "good" or "bad" from his shelf of scrapped parts. His external hard-drives are also overpriced and outdated in my opinion. I got mine at Wal-mart for less and at least it was made in this decade.

I would advise anyone to not use this business at least for repair. Dan is well aware of what he is doing. It might be more expensive to get a Geek Squad membership but at least they will give you proper business and advice.

name: Drew West
text: Excellent service! I highly recommend these guys.

name: The RC1
text:
I took my laptop into Dan after spilling some water under it and causing enough damage for it not to work.  He looked at it and took some of it apart and told me a memory card was messed up and he thought the motherboard was bad.  He proceeded to give me an estimate of up to $300 and told me he would ship it off to a company in San Diego he works with and they could fix it and it should be ready in two weeks.  He also told me my computer was under warranty which i was aware of but clearly spilling water on your computer is a breach of warranty so he told me if money was an issue to lie to dell and try to get them to fix it for free, i told him i did not want to do that so i gave it to him to fix. He made me put down a $100 deposit which he said consisted of $30 of shipping each way, which immediately confused me because my laptop weighs maybe 2 pounds, and $40 of labor on his part.  Reluctantly i did.

2 weeks later
I get a call from dell telling me to go pick up my laptop from the technician and ship it to them to fix it  for free.  So i go to Dan and he tells me he never sent my laptop off (so he has been sitting on it for 2 weeks and didn't tell me anything about a change of plans) and he looked at the back and saw it was under warranty (Duh, i know. but i breached the warranty).  He then proceeded to tell me he tried to call dell and get them to fix it and talked to them about it and they told him it was a bad motherboard.  They wouldn't let him ship it to them because he doesn't own the laptop.  I tell him to just give me the laptop and ill ship it to them (because i don't want it back in the slow ass amount of time he does things in). He gives me the laptop and i ask about the $100 deposit.  He says he has already spent wayyy to much time on it and says i'm lucky he didn't charge me more.  !!!( He charged me $100 to look at my computer for 20 minutes and then talk to dell on the phone for 1 hour, which i did not pay him to do, nor did he ask me before he did)!!! so i get my laptop and leave hoping to never deal with this individual again.

!!Read This!!
I give my laptop to dell and get it fixed for less than he quoted me and they get it back to me in 10 days.  I still had to go through the entire troubleshooting process with dell which took 1 hour 15 minutes on the phone which Dan said he did for me. At no point did they mention a motherboard.  Actually at no point did they predict any problems.  The problem was a hard drive and the memory.

An educated guess
I personally think Dan was trying to get my laptop fixed for free by Dell and then tell me he fixed it and charge me out the ass for fixing it, do i know this? no. Maybe he is just extremely incompetent at guessing problems.

Conclusion
Terrible experience, treated me like an idiot, slow, rip off, DO NOT USE

name: Deshaun Westbrook
text: I took my computer into Bisdex last week for repair. The technician took his time to find the problem, and gave me an estimatement. I agreed to the repair. The repair was done to my exspection, the technician took the time to explain the work done. Over the last five years all repairs have been satisfactory. Im very happy and I recommend Bisdex.

name: Michael Stivender
text: Considering the area that Tuscaloosa doesnt offer many computer fix me places I was impressed with Bisdex. They took their time to actually look at my lab top and said they would find whats wrong with it versus just buy a new one. The other place in town said its not worth fixing, just buy one. Well Dan kept it ran test installed new Hard drive and now its performing very well. Even installed things like Office and spyware material that wasnt available to me before. Took the time to show me how to run everything before I exited the store. Its a mom and pop that repair place, but it is friendly. Looks arent that friendly but we are talking about Tuscaloosa, after all we cant even repair homes in 3 years after a tornado.

name: Drew Mcdonald
text:
I had a problem with my computer hinge. Basically it broke off of the backing. Well I've been staying with my grandparents for the summer and I had no idea where to go. I got a recommendation to go to Bisdex. I took the computer in and right away he started pulling the front off of the computer. To me it seemed like he didn't really know what he was doing because once he pulled it off he said he needed to wait for a guy named taylor to come and do the work.I left the computer with him expected he knew what he was doing.

Well about 4 hours later he calls me and says there is good news and bad news. He says we may have fixed your hinge but your screen is not working. So I ask him "Ok well what can you do to fix it?" He tells me that he can't. At that point i'm upset because I had a perfectly good computer(An HP Pavilion m6 with beats audio) aside from a broken hinge and he broke the screen. He tells me that he's not responsible for the broken screen and says that he can sell me a new computer. Well I told Dan that i'm upset because he broke the screen. Well he hung up on me. I called back and his rudeness just got worse. Well in the end he fixed the screen, the hinge is still broken and all in all the computer has some other cosmetic issues that it did not have before. NEVER USE BISDEX!

name: Timothy Keele
text:
Dan was unprofessional and condescending.  I got my laptop second hand at a great discount, because it was a model made with weak hinges, causing the previous owner to have the screen replaced after an accident.  After I dropped it a short distance on its hinge, the display ceased to work, even though the rest of the laptop's functionality was normal.  I figured that it was a pretty open-and-shut loose wire problem, and that it would help to tell Dan these things when I arrived.

However, when I brought the laptop in, I accidentally grabbed the wrong, but near identical charger.  After he learned I brought the wrong charger, he treated me like a complete idiot, and disputed most anything I had to say.  The laptop's power button was flashing the 'low battery' pattern that I recognize, because Alienware laptops have highly customize-able lights.  Dan insisted that he couldn't do anything until I brought the proper charger in, because the laptop could have been flashing an error code, possibly indicating a software issue.  I was ready to fetch the proper charger, but wanted to leave the laptop with him while I did, explaining that I recognized the pattern and it was probably a hardware issue similar to the one it had before.  However, he pressed upon me that it was likely a software issue, 'proving' this by hooking it up to a monitor by VGA, and getting no response.  My laptop has never allowed the shortcut keys on my laptop to reroute the display until I got past the login screen, which we obviously couldn't do without a display, so this was a pretty irritating response.

He then repeated his point about the potential of an error code in the flashing power button light several times, using increasingly smaller words each time, and gave me a little diatribe on the importance of bringing a charger with you when you get a laptop repaired, a point that I had already raised, apologized for, and was so blindsightingly obvious as to be insulting.  After the fifth iteration of the 'error code' talk, we left.

TLDR;
The problem was a loose connection, and took another business less than half an hour to fix.  In the same amount of time, Dan had unsuccessfully plugged in a VGA cable, explained to me the importance of chargers and batteries, misidentified the problem, and ignored anything I had to say about the origin of the problem and the way my laptop worked.  At least he didn't try to charge me as I left.

name: Jasmyne “FatGirlish” bay
text: I had a netbook, the very very laptop, I took it to this company after reading these "great reviews".... I get to the store the man took very long to come from the back I stood alone and waited for about 5 mintues wondering was anyone there. Once he came up he seemed very nice, he looked at my laptop and gave me an estimate for my laptop. it was a bit pricey(broke college student budget), he then told me "wait lets try to work something out", so I listen to his proposal he dropped the price down a good bit for me, told me he needed a deposit to go ahead and order my screen, I was hesitant but since there a much needed thesis on my laptop and I didn;t have time on myside, we both agreed on the lower price(I didn't realize till later on the agreement he had wrote down 3 prices for "labor" he talked over that bit of info), I didn't get my laptop for days later(he told me it wld be ready in 2). Once i get there he was talking to another customer for 20min while I waited. He went to get my laptop, and i see the invoice had a whole new price, his labor had went up .  He could have explained how his price could go up , or gave me range that the price may be. I had to ask my father for the money just to get my laptop out. name: Russ Garcia
text: Bad experience - took my laptop in for a vrus cleaning,  paid  $50 for them to do a rush job. They said two days max. I get it back in 4 days, with many changes. The resolution was much smaller,  2 of the passwords were gone  (1 was my very important google account ). I could not retrieve it. They couldn't ether. Why not, they are the "experts). I went back to them, had a very heated argument of which the tech became rude using raw language and telling me I was p**sing him off. I  finally left the store very disappointed saying I would write a review, and I even threatened him with a letter from my brother-in-law who is an attorney.  Don't use this outfit,  stay away ! ! !

resp.text: The laptop was brought in on 12/14 at 11:25 in the morning, and was returned to Russ at 1:43 on 12/16. We were closed on this Saturday so I made a special trip just to meet him for pick  up.  I can provide receipts as proof of the time frame.  Mr Garcia had fallen for a scam artist and had allowed the person access to his computer. The laptop was terribly infected. I cleaned the system of the infections, tools, and changes made to his computer, which I cleaned and worked through midnight on Friday night to ensure he would have it back on Saturday.  To work on the computer I had to set the desktop magnifier back to normal 100% rather than 150% magnification. On opening Monday morning, 12/18, he came back into the shop very angry and abusive, complaining he couldn't see his desktop.  I set the desktop magnification back to 150%, and he told me about the password problem.  I tried to go through the 2 step verification with him to retrieve his password, but since he had previously done this multiple times at home , he had been put into "time out" by Google, telling him to come back and try again in a few hours.  He demanded that I call google and get it fixed, which google doesn't do (to my knowledge).  I asked him to be patient and try again later, but he continued to be abusive.  We did receive a message that the password was changed 6 days before, which would have been December 12.  He stated he thought he knew the password, but it didn't work.  I tried tell the customer that these safeguards were in place for the safety of his account and information, but he refused to believe that I couldn't just pick up the phone and call Google and get this problem fixed.  All other work was performed to his specifications.

name: Margaret Teare
text:
Great staff with incredible knowledge! Don't buy your equipment ANYWHERE else whether you are a company or an individual in West Alabama. Buying printers, computers, including Mac related products at their subsidiary, The Core, costs the same as buying at Best Buy, Staples, The Iphone Clinic, except you get to avoid set up problems, software and hardware conflicts and unnecessary downtime.

Its owner, Tuscom, AND The Core, is THE ONLY CERTIFIED Mac Reseller and SERVICE PROVIDER, in Tuscaloosa and Northport. Do not take your iPhone, iPad, Macbook Pro, Macbook Air to anyone else because if that company messes up your equipment a certified service provider CANNOT fix it legally. Just because the company has Iphone or Mac in its name, does mean that company is legally allowed to work on Mac products. Don't be fooled!

They troubleshot my Mac (for free) and uploaded my software and files to my new Mac for the same price as buying the computer. As my business grows, I will buy EVERYTHING from them. Run, don't walk, and sign up with these guys if you own a business, small or big. You will save so much money and headaches as you grow.   The employees will NEVER sell you anything you don't need AND will answer any question you have, whether, you are a tech newbie or a pro, in language that mirrors your level of knowledge. That kind of integrity is priceless.

Rob is great!

name: cindi partin
text: I normally do not leave lengthy reviews but I've really noticed a considerable change over the last year regarding customer service, management, and my overall shopping experience. I have purchased the majority of my home's furnishings and appliances just over the last six months alone as I have been remodeling. Your Sales Manager, Nicholas, is warm and inviting. He has gone above and beyond to meet and exceed my needs (from helping to select the right colors and fabrics of my furnishings to match and contrast properly down to suggesting the Porter Cable tools for my many DIY projects), and has even made this whole remodeling process much easier. He has truly made me feel like family as I know I am welcome to contact him at any time with my many questions. Both Katie, the store manager, and Nicholas are huge assets to Rent-A-Center, imho. Anyhow, had these changes not occurred you all would have lost me as a customer due to the previous management., so kudos to you for stepping up! In addition,  they have been incredibly helpful and supportive during the current pandemic of COVID-19. So, if anyone has had a bad experience in the past, go see Nicholas and Katie. I do believe you will be pleasantly surprised.

text: I have been doing business with this rent a center for YEARS and I have always had a wonderful experience. The customer service is spot on and they are ALWAYS there to help.

name: Samantha Parks
text: I am a first time customer of Rent a Center. This will also be my last time. I will NEVER do business with these people again. I came in looking for a playstation. To begin with they were great. They said no problem and brought me out a 500 GB playstation. I got it home and....well let's just say it IMMEDIATELY went back. It came with FREE bugs. They told me it would be a few days before they would be able to get me another. So I waited. Finally they called and said they had a brand new one in. I went to pick it up and turns out it was brand new but it had more storage. They said that the whole thing was their fault so they wouldnt charge me anymore and gave me an extra controller. Turns out THEY LIED! BECAUSE THEY GAVE ME A PS4 FILLED WITH BUGS, THEY CHARGED ME FOR THE EXTRA SPACE AND THE EXTRA CONTROLLER THEY TOLD ME WOULDNT COST ME ANY EXTRA! So at this point I'm already aggravated. It gets much worse. I'm standing in line to pay one day, and the 2 customer reps were speaking to each other. The one lady said "Weve got people that haven't paid  in almost 4 weeks. If they would just pay on time we wouldnt have to go repossess their things". Okay no big deal. Every now and then I get a week behind. BUT I ALWAYS CALL AND LET THEM KNOW AND I ALWAYS PAY FOR 2 WEEKS PLUS THE EXTRA FEES THEY TAK ON!!!! ALWAYS! The most recent week I was 5 days late. I called them and told them. And they had the audacity to tell me they would have to come and take it if I didn't come pay it within 2 days. I ONLY HAVE 100$ LEFT AND YOUVE GOT PEOPLE THAT ARE 4 WEEKS LATE AND YOURE GOING TO COME TAKE MY PLAYSTATION THAT I HAD TO WAIT AN ENTIRE WEEK ON BECAUSE OF YOUR MESS UP!!!! YOU ADD EXTRA FEES!!!! YOU LIED AND MADE ME PAY MORE BECAUSE OF YOUR MISTAKE!!!! I told my mother and sister in Law yall were great to go get Washer and Dryers and TVs from. I gave yall business and this is how I get treated? When I pay the playstation off I will NOT be getting my Sofa from you. I will go to Aaron's and NEVER BE back. I will tell my mother and Sister and Law to go to Aarons. I will review you on every social media account I can because of how you treated me. My email is parks.samantha1031@gmail.  Fix this and I will gladly change my review. My Playsation should have been FREE for the mess you made. I've never in my LIFE! I expect an email or a phone call to fix this. Then again it's looking like money comes before customers.

resp.text: We take pride in our product hygiene and cleanliness, Samantha. We have very strict cleanliness standards for all of our products. We retain professional relationships with third party vendors to scrutinize our best practices, and support our continued efforts in maintaining product integrity. Your feedback is important to the RAC experience, and I have escalated the opportunity to your District Manager, Robert. Our Digital Care team is unable to locate your Customer agreement in our systems to reach out. Could you please contact our Solution Center at 1-800-422-8186 to activate the best RAC support? Thank you. ^RAC Digital Care

text: I am a committed customer of Computer Doctor and have been for approximately 5 years.  The services provided has been nothing less than outstanding. text: My computer got hacked with a scammer attempting exploit money from me.  I took my laptop to the computer doctor and they disinfected my laptop and got me up and running again.   Great place to do business.

text: What can I say more?   I read the reviews before using this repair shop and decided to give them my business.  All I can say, the 5 star reviews are not fake! These guys know more about technology than anywhere else I've been. After Best Buy told me my motherboard was fried, Computer Doctor repaired my motherboard issue in the local shop and did not have to send anything offsite.  Its good to have a local shop that can repair electronics in-house.  I'm a customer for life!!

name: Judy Denham
text: Took my laptop in because it would not power on.  The doctor know what the problem was from his years of experience.  He advised me that the laptop is indeed powering on but there is no display.  He quoted me a price to repair the motherboard and told me I could pickup the next day.  I appreciate his knowledge and professionalism.  This place is well worth the visit and if I ever need any other word performed I will choose computer doctor again.

name: Judy Ruffer
text: I brought my computer to have it upgraded to windows 10.  In addition I spoke with them about  an email problem I was having with my spectrum email account.  I was not able to send or receive emails on my iPad, my Apple Watch, or my desktop computer.  I was advised that the issue was with me using an old Bright house email account.  The doctor took time to explain that when spectrum took over bright house, the  mail servers changed and i would need to be set up with the new settings.  He figured it all out and configured the proper setting on both my iPad and my Apple watch, and stated he would do the same on my desktop once its upgraded.  I love this place, they go above and beyond to satisfy the customer.

text: These guys are great and they really know technology.  They stay backed up with work so sometimes repair times can be a little longer. But the customer service is great and the work performed is well worth the wait.

text:
These guys are overpriced, unreliable, and will scam you out of your money. Brought my computer to get it checked and fixed. $175 dollars later they tell me its unfixable. Next i need data Transferred from one sd card to another and they wanna charge $100 for just that. Office depot charges $50. They charge you upfront as well and have a big NO REFUNDS sign behind them so if you swipe your card and try to cancel your order as your standing there they will NOT give it back even if you didn't use them for anything. Got scammed out of over $200 here cause they can't fix things.

In closing, go LITERALLY anywhere else before you go to these guys. It'll be cheaper, it'll be more reliable, and if they can't fix it more than likely they'll give you your money back. I know for a fact Office Depot will, Best Buy will, and Geek Squad will.

text: Drove an hour to get computer fixed. We called a head of time and they were gone. Said they could help us in 45 mins but that would waste our whole day. 2 hours wasted.

resp.text: You called yesterday and inquired about our services.  However, YOU DID NOT MAKE AN APPOINTMENT FOR TODAY.  Had you made an appointment we would have available to accommodate you. Another customer called for an on-site service call and we were out taking care of that customer. It's customers like you that we have no desire to do business with in the first place, who take advantage of the system and leave negative reviews when you haven't done your part. name: Grace Pilgrim

name: Saundra Moore

name: rodsalyn patrick
text: Went above and beyond , I Came in and he fixed my laptop right away!

name: Carol wright
text: Seldom anyone there, but when he is, he is very helpful.

resp.text:
Mr Wright, I am ashamed of your comment. To give my company 3 stars just because we are not sitting around waiting on your arrival is not fair. Has it ever dawned on you that we are not sitting around twiddling our thumbs, we are not at the bowling alley having fun, we are not at a social party ,  we are working even when we are not at the store location. It's called out on a service call.

We have a sign permanently posted to the front door that states if we are not at the store please call the number listed and a rep will arrive to assist you within 15 minutes.  We have been at this location for 10 years, during that 10-year tenure my records show that we have service your computer needs just two times once in 2013 and once in 2014. Here it is 2018 that you show up and leave a negative review because you arrive one or two times and there's no one at the store to assist you. During our 10-year tenure there have been computer stores that have come and gone however we have survived, and the reason why we survived is because we do good work and most people obey the sign that is posted on the door.

If they come and we're not present they follow the instructions they simply pick up their cell phone dial the number listed and Presto a representative arrives within 15 minutes just as stated. You have been most unfair in your review, has it ever dawned on you that we are the only full service retail computer store that's in operation in Wetumpka also within a 20 to 30 mile radius? Shouldn't that alone tell you that we are busy and there will be times when we're not at the store?  You do know that we have a telephone number that most people call, even to make appointments.

Did you pick up the phone and call us to inquire about where we are what we're doing? All of the previous years that we've service you, you've never taken the time to say anything good let alone take the time to leave a positive review.  But here it is after 10 years of service you choose to leave a 3 star review not in regard to our work or the quality of work,  but you leave a 3 star review all because you arrived and no one was at the location, and you failed to pick up the phone call call.

We service residental and business customers alike, and we provide house calls and onsite service to both. When a business calls us and states there main business computer is down, we setup an onsite service call leave the store even at times when no one will be left to service the store. Why do we do this?  Its not personal its just business.  There is more money to be made in one business service call then there is for us to sit in the store waiting on residential customers to find the time to bring there computer in.   For you to reply to our absence as thow we are out on lake martin fishing rather than taking care of business is certianly not fair judgment. The good book says "Judge not lest you be judged, for the same measure in which you judge others, you will be judged".

Maybe the next time a solicitor comes to your residential door in an attempt to sell you a product and you're not home, maybe that's solicitor should log on to Google and leave you a negative review. Not based on the fact that you didn't buy his product, but a negative review based solely on the fact that you were not even home.

In closing, I would like for you to exercise your right to choose another store to do business with.  Best Buy would be the closest and is only 45 miles away from your residence.  I just can't see the logic in us continuing to service someone who has Judged us so unfairly. If you would like to discuss this matter further, our phone number has been the same now for 10 years. I hope you have a better day.

name: Jonny Gaston - Evangelist
text:
I really was hopeful that this business would be a overall pleasant experience. Got my 2017 IPad fixed there. Customer service was great in the beginning. But then it took extra long for them to repair my iPad. Cosmo said 5 days. I still had no iPad for 12-14 days. Every time I called they gave me the “run-around”
They left some messages and they also was waiting on me to give the ok to wipe my iPad since it was disabled. However when I called because I still had no idea when I would get it back, all I got was excuses why it was my fault it had not been repaired yet.

I finally got it back when I pressed them to make it happen. And they did a good job at the repair. I might even give them another shot and change my review, but for now my experience was frustrating. All I needed them to say was “Hey , sorry that’s our fault for giving you an unrealistic timeframe for the repair, we are going to make this right!”

But all I got from them was a bit of an attitude and excuses.

I need my Mac book fixed as well. I might go else where. But I am not closed to giving them another chance. Maybe they were just having a bad day. I’m not sure. I wish my experience was better.

resp.text: I’m sorry that your experience was less than ideal and we will try to set better time expectations for you in the future.   Since the device was disabled we didn’t want to reset the device to factory without your permission since doing so deletes all the data on the device.  In hindsight, we should of gotten your permission to reset the device when you dropped it off with us.  Had we done so, the repair would of been completed much more quickly.   I hope that you do give us another chance to serve you, and I promise we will get your MacBook fixed in a timely manner.

name: John Bobbitt
text:
Called them regarding some new, and some used parts id like to sell from an aborted build, plus others besides. Told them exactly what (SPSPECIFICALLY AN INTEL PROCESSOR, expandable RAM, motherboards, lcd screen,) I had and they told me to come on. I went to probably irritating lengths to confirm that they bought these highly specific parts. In retrospect, I thought the name,odd, but after a long day didnt put the "mac" portion together....or I'd have asked SPECIFICALLY if they bought non-mac items. So,  I drove out from Theodore during rush hour....and they declined everything because it wasnt MAC (wed discussed what I had, mind you) and because they couldn't test board soldered parts.... He said that in refereme to RAM memory chips, a desktop cpu, and my 500gb hard drives...they only take solid state now, he said. And so on, and so on...

I dunno what the game they were playing was, but I think experimac owes me a half tank of gas and an appology. Take the gas from the guy's paycheck (if you're paying guys who think UPGRADABLE RAM is soldered to the board, anyway. And processors and graphics cards for that matter) for so politely convincing me to bring it all out there after being given models and brands.  Everything I could do to maintain some class before I left. Nothing worse than going out of your way to ensure its not a fruitless trip, only to get there and find some genius has given you bad info...and then instead of owning it....lying through his teeth ever so easily with a smile on his face. Aparently my cloths from a day under my cars hood, disguised my occupation as an aerospace engineer.... and I looked like someone who believed hard drives require soldering. In the parking lot now trying to figure gasoline vs. Dive distance.

RESPONSE TO BUSINESS: No, I'm passing. At this point, I believe ive done what's necessary to prevent this happening to someone else. I've made them aware. You know who screwed the pooch, you know what they did...and for that matter, the african American young man who provides the quotes (according to the Liar) knew, and yet hid in the back and let the guy I dealt with do his thing. I'm wondering if THAT is in the fact Cosmo you speak of. In which case, he didnt do anything then, so I dont believe hed do anything NOW. I dont believe your store would have poated a response at all, if not for the star by my name.

You intentionally ignored my suggestion of gas compensation, and while your words are very well put together to give the impression of being amicable....the previous young mans words were pretty enough to get me out there. Fool me once, sir....yet not twice.

A whole paragraph you've written in response that says essentially... Nothing.

2 weeks Later: See folks? Still no response... Just ran and hid. Guilty.

resp.text: We apologize that we did not make it clear over the phone that we only buy Apple products.  You should of been told this over the phone.  We want to talk with you about the experience so that we can avoid something like this happening to anyone else.  Please call us at the store 251-308-8276 and ask for Cosmo.

(i have leased with this company on a previous occasion, my experience at that time was very sub par. the delivery was late and the dryer power cord  was damaged to the point of causing property damage to my wall plug in my home.) A red headed woman approached the counter with no mask and asked me "how can i help you?", i replied i am looking to lease a laptop. she then told me "i have the desktop over there" i stated then what kind of laptops do you have " the kind that turn on!" she stated. so i disregarded her unprofessional remark still uneasy about both employees not having on a face covering, and asked to know my options of computer choices. she then with an attitude that i was an inconvenience to her began putting laptop boxes on the counter. i read the specifications and made my choice. she asked if i had leased with them before, i stated yes. it had been more than 30 days since my last lease so i was directed to fill out another lease application. during this time of filling out the application i came to find out the employee that was behaving in this manner was the general manager. she then informed me while i was filling out the rental application that she "hated these mask" and that i did not have to wear mine while in the store. i was now fully uncomfortable from a collection of lack of safety procedure during a pandemic. i continued to wear my mask. once the application was complete another employee then took a copy of my drivers license. the general manager took another 10 minutes to ask me to please come into her office. she was pulling up things on her computer. she then turned to me and rolled her eyes and said" so you have rented from us before huh? " i said yes i have multiple times. she then proceeded to question why i was late on my rental payment. i told this brute of a woman that i had financial hardship and lost my job at the time. i got behind on the lease and once i realized i could no longer afford to get the payments from these loan sharks up to date due to exorbitant late fees and penalties i returned the leased merchandise. she then stated that she "believed in giving second chances". i  acknowledged the comment but did not rebut to the comment. she then looked over more information on her computer. and turned to me and said " being late im ok with, but people keeping merchandise that is not theirs im not ok with!!" at this point i have become very uncomfortable and feel as if my visit to the store this day has become a humiliation session for the store manager. i stopped the woman and told her i felt degraded and would no longer like to do business with this establishment. she then laughed at me and said " fine then". i contacted the corporate office for this company and was informed they condone this behavior. a few notes if you intend to rent from this establishment, you may be exposed to covid 19 by employees or other patrons due to lack of adherence of mask mandate while in this location or lease merchandise that has not been sanitized properly. you will be belittled by the staff if you ever have financial hardship while in a lease agreement with this company as well. i hope this review is helpful to those thinking of leasing from this company. i would recommend the better competitor YOURWAY RENT TO OWN which is located at 2547 Bob Wallace ave. when i left this establishment i went to your way and was able to lease a laptop computer in less than 15 minutes without being belittled or shamed. (quick your way rent to own history) they do not charge daily late fees(best ways policy is built to extort with late fees)  when a payment may be late and will work with you if you hit financial hardship. also the merchandise is of higher quality, the facility is cleaner, with more inviting more professional staff. stay safe out there in this pandemic!

name: William Blackburn
text:
I rarely write reviews of companies, but this company did an outstanding job in repairing my computer.

I'd been having consistent trouble with my computer for quite some time and had tried to repair the issue I was having multiple times. While I am not a computer expert, the issue was centered around my wi-fi and appeared to be one of significant complexity.

I had previously asked a popular, nation-wide computer repair service to repair the issue and they failed to do so multiple times. I decided to call Networx Computer Technologies to see if they could get the issue sorted out and I am happy to report that they cleared up the issue very quickly and for a very reasonable price.

This organization has my full faith and the professionalism that they have shown me was simply outstanding and easily among the best I have experienced in this arena.

name: Elliott Knight
text: Best computer techs you could ask for. I have been here multiple times and they have always solved my issues very quickly. They don't overcharge and always treat you with respect.

name: Caleb Higdon
text: I had a problem with my PC that I couldn't figure out. I built my PC and I know what I'm doing, I only took it to them because i hoped the actual professionals could find the problem. I dropped it off and told them a little about the problem and they told me they shoot for 24-48hr repairs and there was a $30 minimum diagnostics fee. I agreed and left. They did the same troubleshooting things that I did and came to the same conclusion I did: a new motherboard would fix the problem. I accepted my fate. That was on Friday. On Monday I called and asked if there were anymore developments. They said the motherboard was the issue and that I could pick it up. I asked if the 30 dollars included tax. They said because it was an extended diagnostics period that the fee was now 45, to which I never agreed. I paid it anyway and when I got home I realized a fan was disconnected and so was my RGB LED strip. They didnt put them back the way I left it. On top of that, the pin header for the strip was bent and it snapped off when I tried putting it back in. I booted my system up using a different CPU and it worked fine, only I kept getting some error that wasn't there before. The broken pin and the error wasn't their fault, but they should've plugged the fan and strip back in and properly informed me  about the price hike from 30 to 45 dollars before I agreed to their terms. 3 stars because of the problems mentioned but I wont drop it down worse because I dont know how they could have fixed my computer. They certainly didn't make it better, though. The customer service was good.

name: Kevin Crowley
text:
Glad that Networx was willing to attempt to repair my motherboard. All other computer repair places I called in the area refused to attempt it.

Wish them all the best and will consider them first if I ever need computer services.

text: Recently my elderly mother needed some computer repair and I contacted Daniel at Valley Computer in Decatur, AL. name: Harland Underhill
text:
Yesterday a friend sent me a link with a dire caveat that I'm probably not going to like this but I should see it. I open the link and lo and behold there is my wife, in all her glory, but with nothing else on. Now I've seen this picture before, she took it herself with my own personal phone. No where has this picture ever been shared, sent, or even seen by another soul other than myself. That is until I took my phone to get the battery taken care of at CH PC Repair.

Now I understand that this is partly my fault for leaving that picture on my phone, I accept that. I had honestly forgotten that it was on there. But I had incorrectly assumed that my personal data would remain personal while my phone was in Chad's possession, but apparently that isn't the case.

While the battery was fixed, I've now got to live with the fact that there are not so tasteful pictures of my wife out there for the world to see thanks to some perv PC repairman. If you for some reason desire to use this child for any repair work, make sure your data is extra secure or you wipe your memory card/hard drive before you take it to him. I'm over being mad at this, I'm just disgusted that there are people still like this out there in the world.

I work extremely hard, and I take pride in my business. I would not do something of this matter. What would I benefit from this? nothing, nothing good at all. I am a man of integrity. I am known for the good work I do, and honestness.

name: Jason Williams
text:
This guy is awful.  No patience, no respect, no apologies when he screws up.  Everything is on his demands, but never his fault.  Respect is free, try giving it away sometime.

Don't believe his stories.  He complained in LESS than a week - regarding a shipment originating in Canada - which were the terms he agreed to when he purchased (and also mirrored by the eBay shipping expected time).  But mistakes happen - all I needed was for him to say 'Sorry, my mistake'...  But he couldn't do that - preferring to say that he would be leaving negative feedback (for something he was completely wrong about).  Fortunately I had not shipped the part yet, as I was going to be in the US shortly, and able to do a much quicker & more secure USPS shipment...  But once you threaten negative feedback over something that you're wrong about, and are repeatedly unable to understand that you're in the wrong - damn right I'm canceling that order.  I have the right to "fire" a customer who is not conducting themselves appropriately.

Most notable is the fact that negative feedback was left for me, and it took ~5 minutes for the eBay rep to review the details and get it taken down.  His complaints to eBay have resulted in absolutely zero effect on my account.  Clearly he was in the wrong in every part of this transaction, and he has YET to take responsibility or apologize for his errors.  I would not trust him to act in an appropriate manner in any facet of business, therefore this review is perfectly valid based on the lack of professionalism he has shown.

resp.text: I purchased an item from this guy on ebay(viridel75) Paid May, 3rd. I complained that it wasn't shipped May, 12th. He canceled the sale without me agreeing. Keeps blaming me for his mistakes. Knows nothing about respect!, Now harassing me?.. Reported to ebay.

name: Carla Hardin
text: Momma had a Samsung Galaxy s6 that just needed a new battery.  Ordered a battery from Amazon and they couldn't get the back of the phone off.  So they call the Verizon retail store in hazel green and the girl told her to take it to ch pc repair and he would do it.  My mothers phone worked FINE when she took it in there.  She could do anything and everything on her phone.  When she went to pick it up the phone would not even turn on.   He said he tried both old and new battery and it still wouldn't come on.  So he took the screen off and put it on another phone and the screen works.  So he is saying that the mother board is messed up.  He can check it out BUT he'd have to charge her to do it.  Momma said he really messed the back up,  like it was melted!!  I met her up there and his attitude is  basically "screw you ".  He insisted that the phone was not working when she took it in.  I asked him why he didn't call her and tell her and he said because she didnt leave a number.  To which my reply is "when you work in customer service like this it is your responsibility to get a number so you can get in touch with the person". He is a total jerk!!  He takes ZERO responsibility for his screw ups.  Said he was not going to make it right.  But he did tell her that he'd buy the phone from her when she bought a new one.  Then he threatened to call the cops on us "because it was after hours, he was closed and we wouldn't leave".  He never asked us to leave, period.  He brags about how much money he makes per year and all of his vehicles and house is paid for.  Good for him.  I dont give a 🐁but what he has and doesn't have.  And now Marina tells us that her stepfather took a phone to him that was kinda messed up and was going to get the guy to repair it.  When he went to pick the phone up or really was messed up!!!

resp.text:
Carla,

This issue is between me, and my client Pam Lanford. You came into my office, clearly disgruntled. You then continued to talk over me without giving me a chance to respond or explain the situation.

Pam visited my store with her device, which she believed to have a battery issue. She provided an aftermarket battery and had explained that an attempt was made, using a hairdryer, to open the casing and replace the battery, prior to me looking at the device. When the device was dropped off, I was in the middle of an extensive repair, as well as having a conversation with a different client. Not only that, but the device was dropped off quickly, without any contact information, and with very few details.

I replaced the battery with the after-market battery she provided and then attempted to boot up the device, but to no avail. I investigated further but was unable to find a solution. Pam then arrived to pick up her device, and she was, understandably, very upset to find it not working. She wanted it in working order right then and there, and while I understand her sentiments, I can only do so much so quickly. I needed more time to troubleshoot and determine the problem and possible solution, but she would not allow it. I was even willing to reimburse her with a fair value for her device.

I have been in business for more than 10 years now. I work hard every day, and I like to think that I am very good at what I do. I manage hundreds of computers monthly, and I repair and fix many devices daily (thousands of devices yearly). I can remove a device's back/screen in a few minutes with simply a bit of heat and some playing cards, and I have never had any issues. I would never damage a device intentionally. I treat all repairs as if they were my own. That being said, mistakes can (and do) happen as there are many risks involved with these repairs, but I do my best to make things right. To me, it's not just about collecting payment for the services I provide—although that is necessary for me to stay in business and provide for my family. It's about building long-term relationships with my clients, and I deeply enjoy helping and providing knowledge to my clients.

This is the first complaint I have received with the BBB, and I would truly like to resolve the issue, and have the opportunity to change your outlook on me and your experience with my business. CH PC Repair is my business—it has my name in it, a fact that I am proud of and would never change.

Sincerely,
Chad Harbin
CH PC Repair

text: It's an older store, but it's well organized and clean. Employees were all friendly and helpful. I did an online print order and one item was wrong. The employee at the print center fixed it immediately and everything turned out great.

name: Amber Puckett
text: I love shopping at this store. I do a lot of personal and business transactions at this store. The staff always makes me feel at home and part of the family.

name: Donna Stamper
text: I appreciate the Office Depot staff walking 20 feet to the ink section to retrieve the single black cartridge I ordered online. Apparently, the online ordering process is only convenient if the item you're ordering is not actually in the store and you need it to be.  Otherwise, you will spend just as much time, if not longer, standing at the online pickup counter trying to pick up the item you searched and already paid for online.  Office Depot scanned my driver license (I had already clarified that I personally would pick up the order, as the online form asks). I was asked twice if I wanted a receipt, once by the computer then by the rep (the receipt already came to my email,  along with the $ withdrawn from my account when I placed the order).  I had to sign the credit card panel.  Honestly, I don't have to do all that when I order $200 worth of groceries online for pickup at Walmart.  Office Depot--please make your online ordering more efficient.  Isn't that the point of ordering online--efficiency and convenience?

name: CC
text: I ordered a poster print at 11:47 am because I needed for a trip I'm taking tomorrow and they claim to provide same day service. They said it would be ready by 7 pm. That gave them 7+ hours to have it done. When I came to pick it up 7pm, the guy behind the counter said, "Yeah, I haven't even started it yet." No apology. When I got upset he asked when I needed it. I said, now. You had 7+ hours to get it ready! I won't being doing any business here again!

resp.text:
Colleen, , I am sorry to learn that you were disappointed with the service you received during a recent visit to your local Office Depot store.  When you enter one of our stores you are our guest, and as such are entitled to be greeted by knowledgeable employees who are willing and eager to assist you.  From your comments, it appears that this is not the level of service that you received, and we regret disappointing you.
""If you would like I can place a note for someone to contact you back after they receive the complaint, would this be okay?" If you would reply back to SocialMedia.Service@OfficeDepot.com . Please enter the store#2645 in the subject line.  Thanks  Shirley!

name: S.Hazen Guthrie
text:
I have had two copying crises.  Not a normal Office Depot customer, I followed a suggestion to try  a particular Office Depot store in my city:  University Drive, Huntsville Alabama.

Customer service by the copy specialist, Katie, was just amazing.  There was no job too unusual, time limit too constraining.  She was creative, competent, and fast.  The second occasion, I was helped by the manager, Gary.  He set me up with the copy center.  Once again creativity, confidence, and service.

As an individual businessperson, my crazy schedule and over-full priority list were made so much easier today.

Thank you!!!

name: Paulette Risher
text:
Yesterday, I purchased a 27" Samsung Computer Monitor.  I installed it and was extremely unhappy with the quality of the color and resolution.

Only then did I go back and read the reviews on the Office Depot website and found that I wasn't alone in my negative assessment.  I called the store and the customer service manager could not have been more accommodating.  There was no whining or critique.  He simply told me to bring it back and they would give me a refund or trade it for another monitor.  This morning I took it back in and the man that helped me could not have been more helpful.  I bought a Dell (one with great reviews).

This is a true example of what excellent customer service looks like.  Thank you!!!

name: Justin Mullen
text: Very disappointing customer service. Came in to pick up extra  mechanical pencils and note cards while in the area and went to the check out.  No one was running the registers, but three employees were behind customer service (2 high school/early college age male and female, as well as a older female)  The two young employees were actively engaged in a conversation, one makes eye contact while the other has back turned but continues with conversation.  The older female notices me as well and has to tell the younger female with her back 4 times to return to her register.  She goes to register, doesn't greet me or ask if I found everything alright.  Instead only asks if I want to sign up for a membership a few times after I decline repeatedly.  She puts my order in the bag and walks off before I can take my card out of the chip reader and back into my wallet.  Didn't even get a thank you for shopping.  Will not return again since staff doesn't want to make their customers feel welcomed or care if they make the sell. Will just order supplies from Amazon in advance, or go to Walmart in a pinch.  At least then I can use self check out.

name: Gwen Thomas
text:
I go to the copy department to get a couple of sheets enlarged. It will be ready in 10 minutes the employee says. I leave and come back in 30 minutes. There is a new lady behind the counter now!! Asking me all kids of questions because the first employee didn't do her job.
So frustrating!! So now I still have to wait.

name: Mattea Matthews
text: Placed an online print order and called to see if it really was going to be ready at 7pm or if I could get it earlier. When I got transferred to their department the girl answered "Printing" I told her about my order and was told "If it said 7pm then it will be ready at 7pm"  then she asked if that was all I needed because she was busy. If ya hate your job that much go find a new one. If management reads this (I really hope you do) if your staff is too overworked and can't keep up with orders than put more staff on and if not then talk to them about customer service. I wont be ordering here again.

name: john morton
text: Friendly staff. Nice set up of products.

name: James Burton
text:
Always available to help. (5 star)

Update Dec 2016 (dropping to 2 star): went by on a Saturday and they were closed by 6:30 even though their sign says they're open till 9. The agent on the phone kept insisting their hours were listed as until 6, and i think he was only satisfied when I read him the hours sign that they really were listed as open until 9.

Update Jan 2017 (dropping to 1 star): I contacted the company about the incident above, and they forwarded my message to the local manager but I have not heard anything after several days. Seems like they should want to fix this. . .

text: This is the 2nd time over the years we've bought a new computer from this Office Depot. They actually have really good prices a wide selection of computers both online and in store, and they are friendly and don't push anything you don't need.

name: youknowit158
text: Walked in to look at chairs for a home office. Now it had been open for 2 hours by the time I walked in, and there was trash all over the floor looks like they haven't clean that place in months. And with the horrible lighting of the place and garbage all over the floor and when I mean garbage I mean candy wrappers pieces of plastic receipts and random other things of trash this place just seemed disgusting in the lack of acknowledging my existence by the employees this place gets one star because there's no option for zero Stars. Myself and one other person were the only customers in the entire store literally the employees had us out number 2 to 1. And no one could even say welcome or even clean that place very lazy employees from what I've seen. I can safely say I will never go back to that place.

name: Emilee Vinton
text: Literally the WORST place EVER! Drive AWAY Drive Away FAST! Go anywhere else! I don’t even know why I keep coming back. Every time I go there to get print work done, they forget about my order and when I go to pick it up they never know what I’m talking about. I even go in an place my order in person every time and they still manage to not do their job! It’s ridiculous and then they expect you to pay full price for a huge inconvenience!!! I needed invites printed out recently and needed to mail them on a certain day. I told the lady she was like sure no problem. It will be ready at such and such time. Keep in mind I have a toddler in which it’s hard enough to make time to run errands. I go in with my toddler to pick up my order and I’m actually an hour later than what she told me because I figured they could use the extra hour.  Well when I get there, they had no idea what I was talking about and said the lady never put my order in. My stuff that I wrote down for her along with my usb drive is missing too. My toddler isn’t happy at this point and neither am I! Finally they find it and he said oh yea it’s not done sorry. I can have it done in like a few hours..... I was like well that’s not very helpful bc I needed them mailed today and he said yes I’m sorry. Okay well do you expect me to pay full price bc I sure as heck am not!!!!! Like don’t go here if you want things done right! This is seriously the worst place to go! I wouldn’t even give them a 1
